history.content:
Is CS188 actually offered in the summer? I don't see it on the catalog. I'll let someone actually answer the OP's question below.

------

children.subject: To anon, who asked a question in the student answer box: please make a followup next time. Using the student answer to ask a question marks this post as resolved, which it is not.

Interesting, because I wasn't initially too interested in taking 188 over a regular semester and having it adversely affect my GPA without learning much from it. However on seeing the cushier distributions for the summer, I was reconsidering not taking it, since I've heard "good things" about the class.

I have to take 61C to graduate and I don't want to take that over the regular semester either since the grade bins from what I've seen on the course website tend to be lower over the summer, with more points (relative to regular semester) for project work, something that I personally prefer over point-heavy exams. If the workload really is too high for 188 over the summer, then I think I'll stick to 61C and working on internship prep, since that's time consuming too.

Definitely would not recommend. CS 61C is a high-intensity course during the Fall/Spring semester itself, and taking it in the summer would require pretty much all of your time as it goes at a much faster pace. CS 188 may have a better curve but having only 10 weeks to absorb all the information is a relatively short time. I would recommend one or the other (CS 188, if you had to choose, just based off of workload), but not both in the same summer.

history.content: Are both doable together over the summer, in terms of workload and pace? As for grading, is 188 any more lenient over the summer? The only relevant datapoint I can see (on BerkeleyTime) is Summer 2018, which had a much nicer grade distribution on the higher end than that of other semesters (more % A/A+). Is the professor for Summer 2019 the same as that for Summer 2018?
history.subject: CS 188 + 61C over summer
